com.xilinx.rapidwright.device

Class Tile

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xilinx.rapidwright.device.Tile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Tile
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class represents the same information found and described in XDLRC files concerning Xilinx FPGA tiles. The representation given by XDLRC files is that every FPGA is described as a 2D array of Tiles, each with a set of sites, and hence sources, sinks and wires to connect tiles together and wires within.
    Author:
    Chris Lavin Created on: Apr 22, 2010
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int column
      Absolute tile column number - the index into the device Tiles[][] array
      private Device dev
      Reference to this tile's device object
      private static Site[] emptySites 
      private java.lang.String name
      Name of the tile
      private int row
      Absolute tile row number - the index into the device Tiles[][] array
      private static long serialVersionUID
      Allows Serializable functionality
      private Site[] sites
      An array of sites located within the tile (null if none)
      private int[] sources
      This is a list of the sources within the tile (generally in the primitives)
      private int tilePatternIndex
      The index of the tile pattern object corresponding to this tile
      private int tileXCoordinate
      This is the X coordinate in the tile name (ex: 0 in INT_X0Y5)
      private int tileYCoordinate
      This is the Y coordinate in the tile name (ex: 5 in INT_X0Y5)
      private TileType type
      Tile Type (INT,CLB,...)
      private int uniqueWireStartIndex
      The global start index for this tile when numbering every wire in the part

      Tile()
      Constructor for the tile class, initializes all the private variables to empty data structures.

      • getWireConnections

        public java.util.List<Wire> getWireConnections(int wire)
        This will get all of the forward wire connections that can be made from the given wire in this tile.
        Parameters:
        wire - A wire in this tile to query its potential connections.
        Returns:
        An array of wires which connect to the given wire.

      • getPIPs

        public java.util.ArrayList<PIP> getPIPs()
        This method will create a new list of PIPs from those existing in the instance of this Tile object. Use this method with caution as it will generate a lot of new PIPs each time it is called which may (or may not) use a lot of memory. O(n) runtime, where n is number of PIPs in the tile.
        Returns:
        A list of all PIPs in this tile.

        public int getTemplateOffset(int wire)

      • getManhattanDistance

        public int getManhattanDistance(Tile tile)
        Calculates the Manhattan distance between this tile and the given tile. It calculates the distance based on tileXCoordinate and tileYCoordinate rather than the absolute indices of the tile.
        Parameters:
        tile - The tile to compare against.
        Returns:
        The integer Manhattan distance between this and the given tile.

                          int wire1)
        WARNING: This method is O(n) where n is the PIP fan out of the wire0
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The PIPType or null if no such PIP exists

      • getGlobalWireID

        public int getGlobalWireID(int wireIndex)
        Get's and returns the global wire ID for the specified wire. This ID is unique in the part (tile + wire instance).
        Parameters:
        wireIndex - Index of the wire within the tile type.
        Returns:
        The unique id of the tile+wire instance.
